manuscript.title: Tenbîhü'l-Efhâm ilâ Tedebbüri'l-Kitâbi'l-Hakîm ve Taʿarrufü'l-Âyât ve'n-Nebei'l-Azîm (تنبيه الأفهام إلى تدبّر الكتاب الحكيم وتعرّف الآيات والنبأ العظيم) — vol. 2
manuscript.author: İbn Berrecân, Ebü'l-Hakem Abdüsselâm b. Abdurrahmân b. Muhammed el-İşbîlî el-Lahmî (d. 536/1142) (ابن برجان)
manuscript.notes: Volume 2 of a 2-volume set. Vol. 1 is shelfmark 00027-001, yek_id 231531, iiif_id 0000000200699 (confirmed, visual confidence 0.92; catalogued 2026-02-27). Both volumes share the same decorative programme: hatip ebrulu vikāye yaprağı, mihrabiye, müzehhep sūre başlıkları, and gold cetvels. Vol. 2 independently corroborates vol. 1's catalogue description with its own 'nüshanın vikāye yaprağı hatip ebrūludur' statement. Binding for vol. 2 not specified in available catalogue records; expected to match vol. 1's luxury meşin cilt (yaldızlı cetvelli, salbek şemseli, köşebentli, mıkleplı). Cross-reference: catalog/damad_ibrahim_pasa_00027-001.json.

paper_decoration.summary: The vol. 2 catalogue independently records 'nüshanın vikāye yaprağı hatip ebrūludur' — a hatip-marbled (floral/vegetal subtype) protective flyleaf at the opening of the volume. The same phrase appears in vol. 1's catalogue entry, confirming this as a consistent decorative feature of the complete 2-volume set rather than incidental to one volume. Beyond the marbled flyleaf, vol. 2 carries the same full luxury illumination programme: mihrabiye (arched niche headpiece), müzehhep sūre başlıkları (gilded surah title cartouches), and altın cedvel (gold ruling lines) throughout. Visual examination of p003 (IIIF) showed only plain cream paper — the hatip ebrulu vikāye yaprağı was not captured on this page. The verdict relies on the independent catalogue corroboration of vol. 1 and the textual description in vol. 2's own record.

terms_used.english: Protective flyleaf placed at the opening of a manuscript; in Ottoman luxury manuscripts frequently executed in decorated paper such as hatip ebru

Decorative headpiece in the form of an arched niche at the opening of a manuscript text

provenance.notes: Volume 2 of a 2-volume tafsīr set; vol. 1 is shelfmark 00027-001 (yek_id 231531), catalogued at catalog/damad_ibrahim_pasa_00027-001.json (confirmed, 0.92). Both volumes belong to the vakfī library of Nevşehirli Damad İbrahim Paşa (Grand Vizier 1718–1730), the principal patron of the Tulip Period (Lâle Devri). The AH 1128 / CE 1715–16 copy predates his vizierate by several years. The vol. 2 catalogue independently confirms 'vikāye yaprağı hatip ebrūludur', establishing the marbled flyleaf as a consistent feature of the complete set.
